My family has long loved Costco. Our experience has always been very positive. We appreciate, too, that Costco is able to provide great products and prices while treating its employees well. When Costco first came to our town, I remember talking to someone who left his job at a similar warehouse store to work at Costco. He reported loving his job saying that Costco treated him with more respect and dignity--and paid better with better benefits. He was more committed to his job and the company because of this. This included him wanting to do the best job that he could do to show appreciation to Costco for how they treated employees. We already liked Costco, but after this, we became much more committed. And I have never had a negative experience with an employee at Costco. We shop there a lot, so this is saying something!!
I can't drink for medical reasons but I fully support your company for supporting us.

Keep up the good work! I am happy to continue to support your company with my spending.

A DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion) policy encompasses everyone, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, ability, socioeconomic status, or other personal characteristics, aiming to create an environment where all individuals feel respected, valued, and have equal opportunities to participate and contribute.
